alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 12:11AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jo Daviess, northwestern Jackson and central Dubuque Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1210 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Peosta, or 9 miles west of Dubuque, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dubuque, Galena, Asbury, Epworth, East Dubuque, Peosta, Scales Mound, Menominee, Council Hill, Centralia, Sageville, Bankston, Durango, Guilford, Graf, Dubuque Regional Airport, Rockdale, Lattnerville, East Rickardsville and Dubuque County Fairgrounds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
